item.title: Betty add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I ate them like salad, books were my sandwich for lunch, my tiffin and dinner and midnight munch. I tore out the pages, ate them with salt, doused them with relish, gnawed on the bindings, turned the chapters with my tongue! Books by the dozen, the score and the billion. I carried so many home I was hunchbacked for years. Philosophy, art history, politics, social science, the poem, the essay, the grandiose play, you name 'em, I ate 'em." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Betty add a quote by Nigel Slater
item.description: "It is impossible not to love someone who makes toast for you. " -- Nigel Slater

item.title: Betty add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Kat bought a New York Times but couldn’t figure out how to operate it, so now she’s fiddling with her phone." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Betty add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Betty add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Betty add a quote by St. Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "Beware the man of a single book." -- St. Thomas Aquinas
